SEARCH
Module edu.upc.subgrupprop113.supermarketmanager
Package edu.upc.subgrupprop113.supermarketmanager.models

Class Supermarket

java.lang.Object
edu.upc.subgrupprop113.supermarketmanager.models.Supermarket
public class Supermarket extends Object
Represents the supermarket system, managing all operations related to users, catalog, shelving units, and various strategies for ordering and file import/export. Implements a singleton pattern to ensure only one instance of the supermarket is created.

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static Supermarket getInstance()
      Returns the singleton instance of the supermarket, creating it if it does not exist.
      Returns:
      the single instance of Supermarket.

    • clear

      public void clear()
      Clears the current state of the supermarket, including all shelving units, logged user, and strategies. Registered users are kept because they are hard coded for the moment.

    • logIn

      public void logIn(String username, String password)
      Logs a user into the system with the specified username and password. Verifies that no other user is already logged in and checks the provided credentials.
      Parameters:
      username - the username of the user attempting to log in.
      password - the password of the user attempting to log in.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if a user is already logged in.
      IllegalArgumentException - if the username does not exist or if the password is incorrect.

    • logOut

      public void logOut()
      Logs out the currently logged-in user.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if no user is currently logged in.

    • getLoggedUser

      public User getLoggedUser()
      Retrieves the currently logged-in user.
      Returns:
      the User who is currently logged in, or null if no user is logged in.

    • createDistribution

      public void createDistribution(int shelvingHeight, ArrayList<javafx.util.Pair<ProductTemperature,Integer>> distribution)
      Creates the distribution of shelving units based on specified temperature types and quantities.

      This method configures the distribution of shelving units in the supermarket to match the specified shelving height and distribution details. The supermarket must be empty.

      Parameters:
      shelvingHeight - the height of each shelving unit, specified in integer units
      distribution - a set of pairs representing the temperature type and the quantity of units for each temperature type. Each pair contains: - Key: a constant in ProductTemperature. - Value: an integer representing the quantity of units for the given temperature type.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the supermarket distribution is not empty or if the logged in user is not the admin.

    • eraseDistribution

      public void eraseDistribution()
      Clears the current shelving unit distribution.

      This method removes all shelving units from the distribution list and resets the shelving unit height to zero. Once called, the distribution will be empty, and shelvingUnitHeight will be set to its default value (0).

    • sortSupermarketCatalog

      public void sortSupermarketCatalog()
      Sorts the catalog products of the supermarket into the shelving units based on the current ordering strategy.

      This method retrieves the current product catalog and organizes them in the shelvingUnits according to the rules defined by the OrderingStrategy. The ordering strategy is applied to the list of shelving units along with all products currently available in the catalog.

      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the current user is not the admin.
      IllegalArgumentException - if the Strategy fails

    • sortSupermarketProducts

      public void sortSupermarketProducts()
      Sorts the products within the supermarket's shelving units based on the current ordering strategy.

      This method applies the specified OrderingStrategy to the list of shelvingUnits, organizing products according to the rules defined in the strategy. The set of products is obtained by calling getAllProductsShelvingUnit(), which retrieves all products currently stored in the shelving units.

      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the current user is not the admin.
      IllegalArgumentException - if the Strategy fails

    • exportSupermarket

      public void exportSupermarket(String filename)
      Exports the current supermarket configuration to a specified file, including the product catalog and shelving units.

      This method verifies that the current user is an administrator, retrieves all products from the catalog, and exports the products and shelving units using the specified file name.

      Parameters:
      filename - the name of the file to which the supermarket data will be exported.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the current user is not an administrator.
      IllegalArgumentException - if the export fails because of the Strategy

    • importSupermarket

      public void importSupermarket(String filename)
      Imports a supermarket configuration from a specified file, updating the shelving units and catalog with new data.

      This method checks that the supermarket has no pre-existing shelving unit distribution. It then imports shelving units and catalog products from the file specified by filename, clears the existing catalog, and validates the new shelving units for consistency in temperature, catalog presence, unique UIDs, and uniform height.

      Note: The shelving unit height is set to the height of the first imported unit, or to 0 if no units are imported.

      Parameters:
      filename - the name of the file containing the supermarket data to import.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if there is an existing shelving unit distribution or if the product relations are incorrect.
      IllegalArgumentException - if any imported shelving unit fails validation in checkRTsImportShelvingUnits or if any imported product fails the restrictions of the catalog.

    • addShelvingUnit

      public void addShelvingUnit(int position, ProductTemperature temperature)
      Adds a new shelving unit at the specified position with the given temperature setting. Assigns a unique UID to the new unit based on the highest existing UID.
      Parameters:
      position - the index where the shelving unit will be added.
      temperature - the temperature setting for the new shelving unit.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the logged user is not an admin.
      IllegalArgumentException - if the position is out of bounds.

    • removeShelvingUnit

      public void removeShelvingUnit(int position)
      Removes a shelving unit in a specified position at the supermarket.
      Parameters:
      position - the index where the shelving unit will be removed.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the logged user is not an admin.
      IllegalArgumentException - if the position is out of bounds.
      IllegalStateException - if the shelving unit is not empty.

    • addProductToShelvingUnit

      public void addProductToShelvingUnit(int position, int height, Product product)
      Adds a product to the shelving unit at the specified position and height.
      Parameters:
      position - the index of the shelving unit.
      height - the shelf level within the shelving unit to place the product.
      product - the product to add.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the logged user is not an admin.
      IllegalArgumentException - if the position is out of bounds.
      IllegalStateException - if the product temperature is not the same as the shelving unit at the specified position.

    • removeProductFromShelvingUnit

      public void removeProductFromShelvingUnit(int position, int height)
      Deletes a product from the shelving unit at the specified position and height.
      Parameters:
      position - the position of the shelving unit.
      height - the height within the shelving unit to remove the product from.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the logged user is not an admin.

    • hasProduct

      public boolean hasProduct(Product product)
      Checks if the specified product exists within any shelving unit.
      Parameters:
      product - the product to search for.
      Returns:
      true if the product exists; false otherwise.

    • hasProduct

      public boolean hasProduct(String productName)
      Checks if a product with the specified name exists within any shelving unit.
      Parameters:
      productName - the name of the product to search for.
      Returns:
      true if a product with the specified name exists; false otherwise.

    • swapProducts

      public void swapProducts(int pos1, int height1, int pos2, int height2)
      Swaps two products located in specified shelving units and heights.
      Parameters:
      pos1 - the index of the first shelving unit.
      height1 - the shelf level within the first shelving unit.
      pos2 - the index of the second shelving unit.
      height2 - the shelf level within the second shelving unit.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the logged user is not an admin.
      IllegalArgumentException - if any position or height is out of bounds.
      IllegalStateException - if the temperatures of the products are different.

    • swapShelvingUnits

      public void swapShelvingUnits(int pos1, int pos2)
      Swaps two shelving units at the specified positions.
      Parameters:
      pos1 - the index of the first shelving unit.
      pos2 - the index of the second shelving unit.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the logged user is not an admin.
      IllegalArgumentException - if either position is out of bounds.

    • emptyShelvingUnit

      public void emptyShelvingUnit(int pos)
      Empties all products from the shelving unit at the specified position.
      Parameters:
      pos - the index of the shelving unit to empty.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the logged user is not an admin.
      IllegalArgumentException - if the position is out of bounds.

    • removeAllInstancesOfProduct

      public void removeAllInstancesOfProduct(Product product)
      Removes all instances of the specified product from all shelving units.
      Parameters:
      product - the product to remove.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the logged user is not an admin.
      IllegalArgumentException - if the product is null.

    • findUser

      public User findUser(String username)
      Searches for a user by their username within the registered users.
      Parameters:
      username - the username of the user to search for.
      Returns:
      the User object if found; null if no user with the specified username exists.

    • getShelvingUnit

      public ShelvingUnit getShelvingUnit(int position)
      Retrieves the shelving unit at the specified position.
      Parameters:
      position - the position of the shelving unit
      Returns:
      the ShelvingUnit object at position specified.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the position is out of bounds

    • getShelvingUnits

      public List<ShelvingUnit> getShelvingUnits()
      Retrieves the list of shelving units currently configured in the distribution.
      Returns:
      an ArrayList of ShelvingUnit objects representing the current shelving units in the supermarket distribution.

    • getShelvingUnitHeight

      public int getShelvingUnitHeight()
      Retrieves the height of each shelving unit in the distribution.
      Returns:
      an integer representing the height of the shelving units.

    • setOrderingStrategy

      public void setOrderingStrategy(OrderingStrategy orderingStrategy)
      Sets the ordering strategy for the current instance.

      This method assigns the specified OrderingStrategy to be used in organizing or sorting items according to the provided strategy's rules. Replacing the strategy will affect all future ordering behavior.

      Parameters:
      orderingStrategy - the OrderingStrategy to be applied.

    • getAllProductsShelvingUnits

      public List<Product> getAllProductsShelvingUnits()
      Retrieves all products currently stored in the supermarket's shelving units.

      This method iterates through each shelving unit and collects all non-null products up to the height specified by shelvingUnitHeight. It returns a list containing all products currently placed within the shelving units.

      Returns:
      an ArrayList of Product objects representing all products in the shelving units. If no products are stored, an empty list is returned.

    • checkLoggedUserIsAdmin

      public void checkLoggedUserIsAdmin()
      Verifies that the logged-in user has administrator privileges.

      This method checks if a user is currently logged in, and if so, verifies that the user has administrator privileges. If the user is not logged in or is not an admin, an exception is thrown.

      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if no user is logged in or if the logged-in user is not an admin

    • checkRTsImportShelvingUnits

      public void checkRTsImportShelvingUnits(ArrayList<ShelvingUnit> shelvingUnits)
      Validates the imported shelving units for consistency in temperature, catalog presence, unique identifiers, and height.

      This method verifies that each shelving unit in the provided list has consistent product temperatures with the unit’s temperature setting, and that each product exists in the catalog. Additionally, it ensures all shelving units have a uniform height and unique UIDs.

      Note: This method relies on the Catalog singleton instance for catalog validation.

      Parameters:
      shelvingUnits - a list of ShelvingUnit objects to validate.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if:
      • any product within a shelving unit has a different temperature than the unit's temperature setting,
      • any product in a shelving unit is not present in the catalog,
      • the shelving units have differing heights,
      • any two shelving units share the same UID.

    • modifyShelvingUnitTemperature

      public void modifyShelvingUnitTemperature(int position, ProductTemperature temperature)
      Modifies the temperature setting of a shelving unit at the specified position.

      This method sets the temperature of the shelving unit located at the given position to the specified temperature. The position must be within the valid range of shelving units in the distribution.

      Parameters:
      position - the position of the shelving unit to modify
      temperature - the new temperature setting for the shelving unit
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the specified position is out of bounds or if the temperature can not be changed.

    • getInfoSupermarket

      public String getInfoSupermarket()
      Returns a string representation of the supermarket. Including the information of all of the shelving units and the products inside them.
      Returns:
      a string representation of the supermarket.

    • getShelvingUnitInfo

      public String getShelvingUnitInfo(int position)
      Returns a string representation of the shelving unit at ones position. Including the information of all of the products inside it.
      Returns:
      a string representation of the shelving unit.
